DOC.HEAD: Governor Rests Well Overnight in Hospital
DOC.TEXT: Gov. Rose Mofford slept well overnight and was in stable condition today after being hospitalized with chest pains, officials said. Preliminary tests after the 67-year-old governor was admitted to St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center on Sunday indicated her gallbladder was to blame. ``I believe they checked out the heart and chest complaints, and they are of less worry,'' press assistant Vada Manager said Sunday night. Manager said he was not aware of any previous problems Mrs. Mofford had with her gallbladder. He said her pain eased after she checked in.
